clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnosis of Peripheral Lung Nodules Using Cryobiopsy
clinical_study.official_title: Bronchoscopic Diagnosis of Peripheral Lung Nodules Using Endobronchial Ultrasound Guided Forceps and Cryobiopsy. A Randomized-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Since the traditional radial endobronchial ultrasound guided biopsy technique of solitary pulmonary nodules using the forceps has several shortcomings, the purpose of this study is to investigate a new biopsy technique using the transbronchial cryobrobe

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective randomized trial to assess diagnostic accuracy and safety of cryobiopsy using two different outer diameters. Included patients are 1:1 randomized to receive forceps biopsy following cryobiopsy with a 1.1mm or 1.7mm cryoprobe.

primary_outcome.description: The diagnostic yield of the malign lesions that we were able to visualise with EBUS in percentage

secondary_outcome.measure: Size of harvested tissue in millimeter
secondary_outcome.description: The biopsies are assessed for total size in millimeter

secondary_outcome.measure: Size of malign tissue in millimeter
secondary_outcome.description: The biopsies are assessed for size of malign tissue in milimeter

secondary_outcome.measure: Size of artifact-free alvoelar space in percentage
secondary_outcome.description: Size of artifact-free alvoelar space in percentage

secondary_outcome.measure: Radial endobronchial utrasound probe orientation (excentric, concentric, adjacent)
secondary_outcome.description: Lesion orientation with regards of the radial endobronchial ultrasound probe

arm_group.description: Forceps biopsy following cryobiopsy with a 1.1mm cryoprobe are obtained within the same session
Forceps biopsy following cryobiopsy with a 1.7mm cryoprobe are obtained within the same session

intervention.description: Once the nodule is visualized by radial EBUS, the position of the probe in relation to the lesion is noted. Routinely, forceps biopsy and cryobiopsy are used serially in each patient within the same session.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Solitary pulmonary nodule with indication of bronchoscopic diagnostic approach
- Age between 18 and 90 years
- Written informed consent after participant's information
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 and > 90 years
- Lacking ability to form an informed consent (including impaired judgement, communi-cation barriers)
- Contraindication against bronchoscopy (e.g. co-morbidities)
- INR > 2 or Thrombocytes < 50000
- Double antiplatelet drugs (e.g. ASS and Clopidogrel) within 7 days before biopsy
- Anticoagulation with NOAK within 48 hours before biopsy
- Moderate or severe pulmonary hypertension (mPAP > 30 mmHg, RV/RA >30 mmHg)
- Tumors suspicious of endobronchial growth
